thread.title: Super Mario Maker surpasses 1 million units sold worldwide - Gaming
thread.title_full: Super Mario Maker surpasses 1 million units sold worldwide - Gaming News - Digital Spy

author: Albaraa Fahmy
title: Super Mario Maker surpasses 1 million units sold worldwide - Gaming
text: More than one million units of Super Mario Maker have been sold globally since its September 11 launch.Additionally, user-created levels in the Wii U game have been played at least 75 million times by Mario fans around the world.#SuperMarioMaker has sold one million units worldwide, with 2.2 million courses being created so far! pic.twitter.com/AZcWZe3odE— Nintendo UK (@NintendoUK) September 30, 2015"For Mario fans around the world, including myself, Super Mario Maker was a dream 30 years in the making," said Nintendo of America president Reggie Fils-Aime in a statement."The game has captured and unlocked the imaginations of gaming fans of all ages and brought their dedication to Nintendo to a whole new level."Using the touch screen of the Wii U GamePad controller, Super Mario Maker allows players to create levels in four different Super Mario game styles. © Nintendo Completed level creations can be uploaded and experienced by other players around the world. All copies of the game come with a copy of a collectible book that features ideas from the Nintendo development team designed to inspire players' creations.Super Mario Maker review: Nintendo's Minecraft for platformers is pure gaming joyCheck out our most anticipated games of September, one of many videos in Digital Spy's dedicated Gaming YouTube channel. Be sure to subscribe!
